intro: Senecio longicollaris, commonly known as the long-necked groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Senecio longicollaris is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
